detailedDescription: Description: Threadneedle House, an investment opportunity comprising 48 apartments in Redditch town centre, Worcestershire. This freehold residential property occupies a prominent position adjoining the Kingfisher Shopping Centre and offers strong rental performance supported by excellent transport links and continued local regeneration. Fully let and income-producing, the property generates approximately £504,000 per annum and includes parking facilities within a well-connected Midlands location. Financial Highlights: The rent is approximately £504,000 per annum Additional parking income is approximately £12,000 per annum Tenure Freehold Title number WR160561 Key Information: Location Redditch, Worcestershire Property Type Residential Apartments Number of Units 48 (mix of 1, 2 and 3 bedrooms) Parking 20 spaces (allocated and visitor) GIA Approx. 0.618 Acres (34,995 sq ft) Local Authority Redditch Borough Council Connectivity Short walk to Redditch Train Station with direct services to Birmingham New Street in under 40 minutes. Easy access to M42 motorway and Birmingham International Airport within 30 minutes by car. Offers in excess of £6,600,000

Description: A highly desirable residential investment opportunity situated in the affluent suburb of Sutton Coldfield. This well-located property offers strong rental income potential and benefits from upcoming regeneration plans that are expected to enhance the area’s value further. The property comprises 63 apartments, including Ten One-bedroom and Fifty-three Two-bedroom units, spanning the first to ninth floors. Total aggregate GIA of 3,251 Sqm approx. Financial Highlights: Estimated Rental Value £800k per annum. The property is held on a Long Leasehold basis of 990 + years Key Information: OIEO £11,000,000 Associated Freehold: WM471348 Local Authority: Birmingham District (B)

Description: Newlands Cottages, located in the picturesque town of Caterham in Surrey, is a former care facility with planning consent for conversion into a residential property. This property boasts a charming four-bedroom cottage alongside an attached two-bedroom annexe. Situated close to the bustling Caterham town centre, residents will enjoy convenient access to various local amenities, highly regarded local schools and excellent transport links to central London. The building would require some modernisation, allowing for a unique opportunity to tailor the property to taste. This offers the chance to add a personal mark while creating a bespoke living space in the heart of Caterham. Layout: Ground floor: Primary access from front, kitchen/dining area, living room, w/c and games room. First floor: Four bedrooms, one of which is en-suite, bathroom and w/c. Annex ground floor: Living room, kitchen, two bedrooms and bathroom. Features: Single garage, lawned gardens & courtyard. Key Information: 6 Bedroom Former Care Facility Planning consent granted for C3 residential dwelling Site Area: Excess of 0.15 acres GIA: 161sqm/1732 sqft Price: £625,000 Title: SY48300, SGL110542, SY234272 Local Authority: Croydon London Borough

Description: ‘Riversholme’ is offered with vacant possession and occupies a site of approximately 0.43 acres. The property extends to around 6,360 sq. ft. (GIA 591 sqm) across four floors and includes ample parking via a generous pebbled driveway, with landscaped gardens to the front, side, and rear, alongside a decked entertainment area. Previously operating as a guesthouse, Riversholme has recently obtained planning permission for conversion into six self-contained supported living units (Use Class C3(b)), making it a versatile opportunity for redevelopment or continued use as specialist accommodation. The building retains a wealth of original period features and provides extensive internal space, including eight bedrooms, multiple reception areas, and a commercial kitchen. The site offers considerable scope for adaptation or further enhancement, subject to the necessary consents, and benefits from close proximity to local amenities and transport links. Property Layout: Basement: Reception area, dining room with original range, two lounges, commercial kitchen, conference room with external access, Ladies/Gents/Disabled WCs, boiler room, multiple storage areas & fire exits. Ground floor: Entrance hall, three en-suite bedrooms, private living quarters with lounge (garden access), bedroom, bathroom, access to basement & upper floors. First floor: Five en-suite bedrooms, laundry room, stair access to attic. Second floor: Eaves storage, roof access. Features: Extensive pebbled driveway, landscaped wrap-around gardens, additional parking, decked entertainment area, planning approved for six supported living units (Class C3(b)). Key Information: Guide Price £550,000 Title SF684326 Local Authority: East Staffordshire District (B)

Description: Presenting an exceptional opportunity with significant potential for development, this property has previously served as a rehabilitation centre. The building offers abundant space for further enhancement and adaptation, featuring 11 bedrooms, a meeting room, two kitchens, a therapy room, laundry facilities, an office, and a basement comprising a staff area, storage, and utility provisions. Exterior amenities include four parking spaces and a secure landscaped courtyard. Layout: Basement: Includes a staff room, store and plant room. Ground floor: 5 bedrooms, a lounge, a store room, a meeting room, 2 kitchens, a therapy room, a laundry room and w/c facilities. First floor: A further 6 bedrooms, with w/c facilities and a store room. Features: Primary access from the front and side of the building, as well as access to the garden area and parking.
